alert.note: Alert for Southern Penobscot (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 15 at 4:32AM EST until January 17 at 5:00AM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches, sleet accumulations around 1 inch and ice accumulations between one tenth and two tenths of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Southern Penobscot County. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 5 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the Monday morning and evening commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of snow, sleet, and ice will make travel extremely dangerous. The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to newengland511.org.
